result.title: Week 2 â€” additional C++
result.content:
Week 1 was a week of snow for us living on the East Coast of US. Fortunately, I am still young enough to celebrate a school closing :) The activity in Codeforces Blogs surprise me: so many people commented on Week 1! It's awesome!

Good news for week 1: I got a chance to look over Good Bye 2017 and try a few problems in Codeforces Round #456 (Div. 2). Cool things I encountered include how division works perfectly in a field mod p in 908D - New Year and Arbitrary Arrangement, and doing a somewhat weird BFS to solve 912D - Fishes. I also got CHelper up and running for all my Java submissions. It's really cool!

Bad news for week 1: I bit off more than I can chew in C++. I only caught up to Chapter 12, and as a result have not played League ever since 1/2. Overestimating what I can accomplish is truly one of my biggest challenges.

In Week 2, I hope to finish the tasks in week 1 and do some additional work with C++. After this, week 3 will be a bunch of algorithm and problem-solving + a Codeforces contest that fits with my schedule (Finally)!

1/8: Chapters 13-14

1/9: Chapters 15-16

1/10: Lingering questions in the book

1/11: Redo section 1.2 of USACO training with C++. Although one section contains many problems, this would not be bad since I have done them once in Java already.

1/12: Redo section 1.3 of USACO training with C++.

1/13: Redo section 1.4 of USACO training with C++.

1/14: Redo section 1.5-1.6 of USACO training with C++ (7 problems).
